children.value: Sourcegraph is the standard developer platform for code search and navigation at many of the largest and most advanced technology companies. With Sourcegraph, every company has access to the same kind of tools that Google and Facebook developers use every day.
We‚Äôre excited to announce Sourcegraph 3.12. In addition to the usual updates, this release includes powerful experimental features. We‚Äôre looking forward to your feedback!

Interactive search mode, search across multiple revisions, repository permissions API, and faster permissions fetching on Bitbucket Server
Every detail that changed in this release
Sourcegraph couldn‚Äôt be what it is without the community

properties.aria-label: Search bar match case toggle permalink

children.value: View on Vimeo
Quickly toggle between case sensitive and case insensitive queries using the
icon in the search field. Previously, this filter was applied by adding
to the search query. The toggle simplifies and standardizes this functionality.
View on Vimeo

When rolling out organization-wide changes, it is desirable to review campaigns with your teammates. Campaigns can now be created and saved as drafts prior to publishing the campaign and creating changesets (i.e. pull requests) on your code hosts. Changes can be published individually while in draft mode to verify the change with a subset of owners.
Code change management campaigns are in private beta.
to see what we have planned, and

properties.aria-label: Download files from code views permalink

children.value: View on Vimeo
Quickly download files from Sourcegraph using the new download icon in the file header.

properties.aria-label: GitHub authentication now supports org membership restriction permalink

children.value: GitHub authentication now supports org membership restriction
View on Vimeo
Organizations using GitHub for authentication can now limit access to a list of GitHub organizations for enhanced security and configuration. In the site configuration
, find the GitHub section (or add it using the ‚ÄòAdd GitHub sign-in‚Äô quick config button). Add the new
setting, and list the organizations whose members should have access to your Sourcegraph instance.

This release contains many exciting new improvements to the Sourcegraph UI, configuration, and search capabilities. We look forward to hearing your feedback about them! Tweet
View on Vimeo

A new interactive search mode has been added to help users construct queries using UI elements. The new UI components help to narrow down search results as you iterate on your search. The existing plain text search mode and the query builder are still available via the dropdown menu to the left of the search bar.
to your user, org, or global settings.

properties.aria-label: Repository permissions API for managing ACLs in Sourcegraph permalink

children.value: Repository permissions API for managing ACLs in Sourcegraph

Sourcegraph now provides a GraphQL API for setting repository permissions. Teams with complex permissioning requirements (e.g., multiple code hosts), will benefit from setting up access controls directly in Sourcegraph. To enable Sourcegraph repository permissions, add
to your site configuration. See the

properties.aria-label: Faster permissions fetching on Bitbucket Server permalink

children.value: Faster permissions fetching on Bitbucket Server

have made fetching Bitbucket Server ACL data faster. To take advantage of this improvement, install the Bitbucket Server plugin and add

Support case field in repository search.

results now display a badge to indicate when a result is search-based. These indicators can be disabled by adding

Campaigns can now be created as drafts, which can be shared and updated without creating changesets (pull requests) on code hosts. When ready, a draft can then be published, either completely or changeset by changeset, to create changesets on the code host.
can be enabled to speed up fetching ACL data from Bitbucket Server instances. This requires
which allows you to configure SSL/TLS settings for Sourcegraph contacting your code hosts. Currently just supports turning off TLS/SSL verification.
Experimental: To search across multiple revisions of the same repository, list multiple branch names (or other revspecs) separated by
. Previously this was only supported for diff and commit searches.
Experimental: interactive search mode, which helps users construct queries using UI elements. Requires the site configuration value
. The existing plain text search format is still available via the dropdown menu on the left of the search bar.
A case sensitivity toggle now appears in the search bar.
Add explicit repository permissions support with site configuration field
The ‚ÄúFiles‚Äù tab in the search results page has been renamed to ‚ÄúFilenames‚Äù for clarity.
The search query builder now lives on its own page at
. The home search page has a link to it.
User passwords when using builtin auth are limited to 256 characters. Existing passwords longer than 256 characters will continue to work.
GraphQL API: Campaign.changesetCreationStatus has been renamed to Campaign.status to be aligned with CampaignPlan.
The experimental search pagination API no longer times out when large repositories are encountered.
We resolve relative symbolic links from the directory of the symlink, rather than the root of the repository.
Show errors on repository settings page when repo-updater is down.
Remove benign warning that verifying config took more than 10s when updating or saving an external service.
repohasfile search filter works again (regressed in 3.10).
Structural search can now run on very large repositories containing any number of files.
changelog for this and previous releases
Thank you to the many people who contributed to Sourcegraph since the last release!
